intro: Saurauia herbert-smithii, commonly known as Herbert-Smith's saurauia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the high-altitude regions of southern China, particularly in Yunnan Province. The plant is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in forested areas with well-drained soil. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
